list.s: As they cooled their palates and ate their dates, the Sheikh's men knew they could not be followed, as they were the masters of their desert domain.

The word colophon has undergone several metamorphoses since its earliest appearance in the 17th century: it originally referred to the inscription at the end of a book identifying its basic bibliographic information, that is, title, author, subject, publisher, date and place of publication, in other words, the information today found on the title page.
